name: Dunst
body:
# Welcome!

Dunst is a minimalistic notification daemon for linux. It's designed to fit nicely into minimalistic windowmanagers like dwm, but it should work on any Linux desktop.

## Screenshots
Across the screen:
![dunst2](http://www.knopwob.org/public/dunst_wide_640.png)

Box:
![dunst1](http://www.knopwob.org/public/dunst_short_640.png)


## Installation

### Arch Linux
There is a package in the aur called [dunst-git](http://aur.archlinux.org/packages.php?ID=52275)

### Installing Manually

```
$ git clone https://github.com/knopwob/dunst.git
$ cd dunst
$ make
$ sudo make PREFIX=/usr install
```

## Configuration
An example configuration is provided as /usr/share/dunst/dunstrc. Copy this to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/dunstrc (this normally tranlates to ~/.config/dunstrc) and edit it to your likings.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
